document.discussion_title: 澳洲人口普查 這個項目…掀起隱私權大戰
document.topic_text: August 11, 2016, 1:43 pm 次 （路透）澳洲正在進行每5年一次的全國人口普查，可得知全民從宗教到收入的概況，但這項調查卻出人意料的成為隱私權疑慮引爆點。 （Reuters）Australia’s national census, which provides a snapshot every five years of the country’s people, from religion to income, has become an unlikely flashpoint over privacy concerns. 澳洲人口普查進行105年來，這次是澳洲民眾第一次被要求在線上填寫許多關於自身的細節問題，引起一些政治人物和隱私權擁護者局部抵制這項調查。 Australians are being asked to fill in a host of details about themselves online for the first time in the 105-year history of the census, leading some politicians and privacy advocates to partially boycott the survey. 澳洲統計局（ABS）表示，蒐集到的資訊很重要，因為它有助於制定公共政策。 The Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) said the information gathered is important because it helps set public policy. 該局還表示，人口普查涵蓋澳洲770萬平方公里(300萬平方英哩)陸地，以及8600座島嶼上每個有人居住的角落。 The census covers every inhabited corner of Australias 7.7 million square km (3 million square mile) landmass, as well as 8,600 islands, the bureau said. 但隱私權擁護者關切資料安全性，以及蒐集與保存姓名地址的方式改變。這些資料現在將被保留4年，而非18個月。 But worries over data security and changes to the way names and addresses are collected and retained – they will now be held for four years rather than 18 months – have privacy advocates concerned. 參議員瑟諾豐發出聲明說：「這次人口普查不是要了解國家概況，而是變成跟隨著每個澳洲民眾的行動監視器。」“Rather than being a snapshot of the nation, this census will now morph into a mobile CCTV that follows every Australian," Senator Nick Xenophon said in a statement. 「ABS未能提出有說服力的理由來解釋為何必須提供姓名，並必須被保存4年。」“The ABS has failed to make a compelling case why names must be provided, and stored for four years." 他擁有橫跨左派、中間派以及右翼小黨派國會議員支持，他們剛在日前舉行的國會大選當選。 He has support from across the left, centrist and right-wing minor parties elected to parliament in a recent general election. 在1995年至2000年擔任澳洲首席統計學家的麥克萊南表示，保留姓名是「ABS對澳洲民眾所犯下最嚴重的隱私權侵犯行為」。 Bill McClennan, Australia’s chief statistician from 1995 to 2000, said the retention of names was “the most significant invasion of privacy ever perpetrated on Australians by the ABS". 內閣部長派恩則認為這種擔憂太過牽強。 Cabinet minister Christopher Pyne dismissed such fears as far-fetched. 不過，瑟諾豐跟3個同僚參議員表示，他們不會在人口普查表上填寫姓名，寧願每天遭罰180澳元。 Nevertheless, Xenophon and three fellow senators have said they will not write their names on the census forms, on pain of an A$180-per-day fine. 說文解字看新聞 make a compelling case意指「提出令人信服的理由」，為英文口語中常見的用法。例句：Yahoo has never made a compelling case for why anyone would want to use its mobile app, which is essentially its homepage in app form.（雅虎從未提出有說服力的理由來為何會有人想用它的行動應用程式，而它根本就只是應用程式版的首頁而已。） 超人氣新聞
